column2: WISCONSIN PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column6: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 2. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 3. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column6: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column8: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column10: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.

column2: 4. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column6: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column8: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 5. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 7. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
8. This road sign means:
9. When driving you should look ________ down the road.
10. The yield sign means:
column4: The traffic light will soon be red.
column6: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.
column10: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 11. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column8: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column10: Do not pass on the left.

column2: 13. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 14. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 15. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.

column2: 16. Excessive speed:
column4: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
column6: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.
column8: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.

column2: 17. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 18. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.
column6: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.

column2: 19. To avoid hydroplaning you should:
column4: stay away from puddles and standing water.
column8: slow down when roads are wet.

column2: 20. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column6: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column8: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column10: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.

column2: 21. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column6: stare straight ahead at all times.
column8: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column10: maintain focus toward the left of the road.

column2: 22. You should use your horn:
column4: when another driver makes a mistake.
column6: to encourage others to drive faster.
column8: whenever it will help prevent a crash.

column2: 23. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: means that you need to stop.
column10: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 24. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 25. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
26. A red traffic sign means?
27. This road sign means:
28. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column6: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column8: Take a cold shower before driving.
column10: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.

column2: 29. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column6: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column10: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 30. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column6: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column8: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column10: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
32. Parking is not allowed:
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 33. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
34. This sign means:
35. Which shape is a stop sign?
36. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
38. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 39. This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
40. The picture shows a _________ sign.
41. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column6: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column8: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 42. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
43. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
44. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Immediately come to a complete stop
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column10: Proceed with caution through the intersection

column2: 45. Before backing up, you should:
column6: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column8: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 46. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
47. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
48. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
49. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column6: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: swing to the right side of your lane.

column2: 50. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column6: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
